sen.j: 臣（しん）は、君主につかえる家来の事。
sen.e: Shin (臣) refers to a retainer who served his lord.
sen.cmt: 同じ漢字でも読み方が違うので、訳をどう表記すればよいかを調べるために、英訳されたWIKIPEDIAでの他の例を検索した結果、漢字（中国語）と英語が併記されていましたので、そのように表記しました。
sen.e: Shin (臣) refers to a retainer who served his lord.
Shin (臣) refers to a retainer who served his lord.
It also refers to the lords.
Also, it is how a retainer would call himself.
Also, it is how a retainer would call himself.

sen.j: 臣（しん）は、漢字の部首の一つ。
sen.e: Shin (臣) refers to one of radicals of Chinese character.
sen.cmt: 同じ漢字でも読み方が違うので、訳をどう表記すればよいかを調べるために、英訳されたWIKIPEDIAでの他の例を検索した結果、漢字（中国語）と英語が併記されていましたので、そのように表記しました。
sen.e: Shin (臣) refers to one of the radicals of Chinese character.
Shin (臣) refers to one of the radicals of Chinese character.
Refer to Shinbu (a group list of Chinese characters classified by the radicals)
Refer to Shinbu (a group list of Chinese characters classified by the radicals).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: Refer to Shinbu (a group list of Chinese characters classified by the radicals).

sen.j: 鈴木新（しん、本名：鈴木新）は、元黒夢のギタリスト。
sen.e: Shin Suzuki (real name) was a guitarist of the former rock group Kuroyume.
Shin SUZUKI (real name) was a guitarist of the former rock group Kuroyume.
sen.cmt: 名字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: Shin SUZUKI (real name) was a guitarist of the former rock group Kuroyume.
He left the group on February 15th, 1995.
He left the group on February 15, 1995.
He left the group on February 15, 1995.

sen.j: 臣（おみ）は、ヤマト王権で使われていたカバネ（かばね）の一つ。
sen.e: Omi indicates one of Kabane (hereditary title to denote rank and political standing) used in the Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty).
Omi (臣) indicates one of kabane (hereditary title to denote rank and political standing) used in the Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty).
Omi (臣) indicates one of kabane (hereditary title to denote rank and political standing) used in the Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty).
It is described in this article.
It is described in this article.
It is described in this article.

sen.j: 臣（おみ）は、ヤマト王権で使われていたカバネ（かばね）の一つで、姓の中では連と並んで高位に位置していた。
sen.e: Omi indicates one of Kabane used in the Yamato sovereignty and denoted the highest ranked title of Kabane along with Muraji.
Omi was one of kabane used in the Yamato sovereignty and denoted the highest ranked title along with Muraji.
sen.cmt: kabane を一箇所削除しました。
sen.e: Omi was one of kabane used in the Yamato sovereignty and denoted the highest ranked title along with Muraji.

sen.j: 元々、ヤマト王権に対して服属した畿内周辺の豪族に与えられた姓であった。
sen.e: Originally, Kabane was granted to the local ruling clans who were subjected to the Yamato sovereignty around Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Originally, Omi was granted to the local ruling clans who were subjected to the Yamato sovereignty around Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto).
Originally, Omi was granted to the local ruling clans who were subjected to the Yamato sovereignty around Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto).

sen.j: ヤマト王権の中核を為す蘇我氏、巨勢氏（巨瀬・許勢）、紀氏、平群氏、葛城氏、波多氏、阿部氏などの有力な豪族がこの姓を称した。
sen.e: The local ruling clans such as the Soga, Kose, Ki, Heguri, Kazuraki and Hata who played a central role in the Yamato sovereignty were termed the Kabane title of Omi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The local ruling clans such as Soga, Kose, Ki, Heguri, Kazuraki and Hata who played a central role in the Yamato sovereignty had this title of Omi.
sen.cmt: were termed the Kabane title of Omi→had this title of Omi としました。
sen.e: The local ruling clans such as Soga, Kose, Ki, Heguri, Kazuraki and Hata who played a central role in the Yamato sovereignty had this title of Omi.

sen.j: また、地方でも有力な豪族に対しては臣の姓を名乗ることが許されている。
sen.e: Also, influential local ruling clans in other areas were allowed to term themselves an Omi.
Also, influential local ruling clans in other areas were allowed to call themselves Omi.
Also, influential local ruling clans in other areas were allowed to call themselves Omi.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』などの中では、臣姓の多くは継体天皇以前の天皇から別れ出た氏族としている。
sen.e: According to the "Nihon Shoki," many clans who were termed the Kabane of Omi were descended from the emperors before the period of the Emperor Keitai.
According to the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), many clans with the kabane of Omi were descended from the emperors before the period of the Emperor Keitai.
sen.cmt: 日本書紀 補足を追加しました。
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), many clans with the kabane of Omi were descended from the emperors before the period of the Emperor Keitai.

sen.j: また、蘇我氏他有力７氏族は武内宿禰を共通の祖としている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Soga clan and seven influential others could be descended from TAKENOUCHI no Sukune.
Furthermore, the Soga clan and seven influential others could be descended from TAKENOUCHI no Sukune.
Furthermore, the Soga clan and seven influential others could be descended from TAKENOUCHI no Sukune.

sen.j: 古い時代のものでは、使主と記述されている例もある。
sen.e: Ancient written documents include descriptions of Omi written in 使主 instead of 臣.
Ancient written documents include descriptions of Omi written in 使主 instead of 臣.
Ancient written documents include descriptions of Omi written in 使主 instead of 臣.

sen.j: この臣の姓を名乗る氏族の中で最も有力な者を大臣（おおおみ）と呼び、国政を預けられた。
sen.e: The most influential people among the clans with the Kabane of Omi were termed O-omi and the affairs of state were put in their charge.
The most influential people among the clans with the kabane of Omi were called Oomi, who was put in charge of the affairs of state.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を変更しました。
sen.e: The most influential people among the clans with the kabane of Omi were called Oomi, who was put in charge of the affairs of state.

sen.j: 一方連（むらじ）の姓を名乗る氏族の中で最も有力なものを大連（おおむらじ）と呼んだ。
sen.e: On the other hand, the most influential people among the clans with the title of Muraji were termed Omuraji.
On the other hand, those among the clans with the kabane of Muraji were called Omuraji.
On the other hand, those among the clans with the kabane of Muraji were called Omuraji.

sen.j: 天武天皇の八色の姓の改革により、臣の姓の地位は上から6番目に格下げとなり、その後は朝臣が、有力氏族の姓となっていく。
sen.e: By reforming the hereditary title system into the Eight Kabane system designated by the Emperor Temmu, the Kabane of Omi was demoted to the sixth highest, and Ason (or Asomi) became the Kabane title for influential clans.

By the Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles) reform by the Emperor Tenmu, the kabane of Omi was demoted to the sixth highest, and afterwards Ason (or Asomi) became the kabane title for influential clans.
sen.cmt: 八色の姓 読みを追加しました。
sen.e: By the Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles) reform by the Emperor Tenmu, the kabane of Omi was demoted to the sixth highest, and afterwards Ason (or Asomi) became the kabane title for influential clans.

sen.j: 八色の姓の改革以降、実際に賜姓される事は無かった。
sen.e: After introducing a new system of eight Kabane, Kabane was not actually granted.
After introducing a new system of Yakusa no Kabane, Omi stopped being granted.
sen.cmt: 八色の姓 読みを追加しました。
sen.e: After introducing a new system of Yakusa no Kabane, Omi stopped being granted.
